subject: Sexual Health
title: The Dual Control Model
description: A fast breakdown of The Dual Control Model for builders.

hook.text: The brain has both an accelerator for sexual arousal and a brake that inhibits it. Both run constantly.

buildup.text: The sexual excitation system detects sexually relevant stimuli and sends signals to increase arousal.

discovery.text: The sexual inhibition system detects threats, stress, and social context, applying the brakes on arousal.

twist.text: Low desire often is not a weak accelerator. It is an overactive brake from stress, shame, or distraction.

climax.text: Understanding your own accelerator and brake patterns is the key to improving sexual well-being.

punchline.text: Sometimes the fix is not more gas but less brake.

quiz.question: What does the sexual inhibition system respond to?
